It must be confessed however that the Gua- ranies of after-times, more humane than their ancestorS, placed dead bodies in clay pitchers. Seeking the savages in Mbaevera in the midst of the woodS, I met with a plain artificially made, the trees being cut down sor the pur- pose, and there I found three pitchers of this kind, each of which would contain a man, but all empty. The bottoms of the pitchers were placed toward the sky, the mouth towards the ground. But from sepulchreS, let us hasten to funeral obsequies.
